name: astral
content:
astral adjective
(STARS)
Add to word list
Add to word list
relating to the stars or outer space: After the 1986 Challenger space shuttle crash, it took some time for the dream of astral travel to be revived. His belief in astrology commits him to the idea that specific events can be predicted on the basis of astral causation.
More examplesFewer examplesAn ancient astral chart was discovered near Bethlehem that was thought to show the position of the stars at the time of Jesus's birth.It was supposed to be space music, but it felt more earthbound than astral.

astral adjective
(FORCES)
[ before noun ] relating to a non-physical universe with mysterious forces in it that some people believe to exist: They claimed to be able to conjure spirits from the astral realms. The stone is said to bring clear psychic vision, and to be excellent for meditation and astral travel. See also
astral plane
More examplesFewer examplesThis energy will flow into your astral body.Our ethereal soul travels to the astral world and returns with advice about why we are here.
